page.title: 11LARKHALL_FARMING
page.content: MOST FARMS IN THE LARKHALL AREA RANGE IN SIZE OF 150_200 ACRES.CROPS INCLUDE BARLEY,POTATOES,TURNIPS AND MANY OTHER VARIETIES OF VEGETABLES. BREEDS OF CATTLE FOR DAIRY FARMING ARE USUALLY FRESIAN OR AYRSHIRE AND THERE ARE NUMEROUS BREEDS OF BEEF CATTLE EG HEREFORD,GALLOWAY,ABERDEEN ANGUS, SIMMENTAL,CHAROLAIS,MURRAY GREY AND HOLSTEIN. BREEDS OF SHEEP INCLUDE BLACKFACE, SUFFOCK,BORDER,LEICSTER AND CHEVIOT. THERE ARE ALSO A FEW POULTRY FARMS IN THE AREA.MARKETS USED BY THE LOCAL FARMERS ARE LANARK AND HAMILTON. THE MAIN PROBLEM FOR DAIRY FARMERS AT PRESANT IS "MILK QUOTAS". THE QUOTA ALLOCATED TO EACH FARM ALLOWS IT TO PRODUCE A LIMITED AMOUNT OF MILK. FARMERS FIND THE E.E.C. HAS HELPED FARMERS AS IT INSURES HIGH PRICES.
